value.halfverse:
O LORD my God, how excellent is your greatness!
 you are clothed with majesty and splendor.
value.verse: Bless the LORD, O my soul; *
You wrap yourself with light as with a cloak *
value.halfverse: and spread out the heavens like a curtain.

value.verse: You lay the beams of your chambers in the waters above; *
value.halfverse:
you make the clouds your chariot;
 you ride on the wings of the wind.

value.verse: You make the winds your messengers *
value.halfverse: and flames of fire your servants.
so that it never shall move at any time.
value.verse: You have set the earth upon its foundations, *
You covered it with the Deep as with a mantle; *
value.halfverse: the waters stood higher than the mountains.
at the voice of your thunder they hastened away.
value.verse: At your rebuke they fled; *
They went up into the hills and down to the valleys beneath, *
value.halfverse: to the places you had appointed for them.
they shall not again cover the earth.
value.verse: You set the limits that they should not pass; *

value.halfverse: they flow between the mountains.
value.verse: You send the springs into the valleys; *

value.halfverse: and the wild asses quench their thirst.
value.verse: All the beasts of the field drink their fill from them, *
Beside them the birds of the air make their nests *
value.halfverse: and sing among the branches.

value.verse: You water the mountains from your dwelling on high; *
value.halfverse: the earth is fully satisfied by the fruit of your works.
and plants to serve mankind;
value.verse: You make grass grow for flocks and herds *
That they may bring forth food from the earth, *
value.halfverse: and wine to gladden our hearts,

value.verse: Oil to make a cheerful countenance, *
value.halfverse: and bread to strengthen the heart.
the cedars of Lebanon which he planted,
value.verse: The trees of the LORD are full of sap, *

value.halfverse: and in whose tops the stork makes his dwelling.
value.verse: In which the birds build their nests, *
The high hills are a refuge for the mountain goats, *
value.halfverse: and the stony cliffs for the rock badgers.

value.verse: You appointed the moon to mark the seasons, *
value.halfverse: and the sun knows the time of its setting.

value.verse: You make darkness that it may be night, *
value.halfverse: in which all the beasts of the forest prowl.
and seek their food from God.
value.verse: The lions roar after their prey *

value.halfverse: and lay themselves down in their dens.
value.verse: The sun rises, and they slip away *
Man goes forth to his work *
value.halfverse: and to his labor until the evening.

in wisdom you have made them all;
 the earth is full of your creatures.
value.verse: O LORD, how manifold are your works! *

value.halfverse: creatures both small and great.
value.verse:
Yonder is the great and wide sea
with its living things too many to number, *

value.halfverse: which you have made for the sport of it.
value.verse:
There move the ships,
and there is that Leviathan, *
All of them look to you *
value.halfverse: to give them their food in due season.
you open your hand, and they are filled with good things.
value.verse: You give it to them; they gather it; *
You hide your face, and they are terrified; *
value.halfverse:
you take away their breath,
 and they die and return to their dust.

value.verse: You send forth your Spirit, and they are created; *
value.halfverse: and so you renew the face of the earth.

value.verse: May the glory of the LORD endure for ever; *
value.halfverse: may the LORD rejoice in all his works.
he touches the mountains and they smoke.
value.verse: He looks at the earth and it trembles; *
I will sing to the LORD as long as I live; *
value.halfverse: I will praise my God while I have my being.

value.verse: May these words of mine please him; *
value.halfverse: I will rejoice in the LORD.
and the wicked be no more.
value.verse: Let sinners be consumed out of the earth, *

value.halfverse: Hallelujah!
value.verse: Bless the LORD, O my soul. *
